Legal_Issue: Was the Board's credibility assessment of the applicants' refugee claim reasonable and based on substantial evidence?
Evidence_Assessment: Contradictions in the applicant's testimony, such as the location of the kidnapping and delayed departure from Mexico
Decision_Outcome: Board's decision was not patently unreasonable
Credibility_Factor: Inconsistencies in testimony regarding kidnapping location and timing of departure
Legal_Rule: Federal Court reviews the Board's decisions under the standard of patent unreasonableness, deferring to factual findings unless perverse or capricious
Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged lack of credibility in refugee claim
Key_Evidence_Considered: Testimony contradictions on kidnapping location and delay in leaving Mexico
Applicant_Challenge: Board's rejection of refugee claim due to credibility concerns
Legal_Rule_Source: Federal Court jurisprudence on standard of review
Defendant_Response: Board justified its credibility assessment based on material inconsistencies
Remedy_Requested: Overturning of Board's negative credibility finding
Legal_Provision: Section 101(1) IRPA, Section 96 Federal Courts Act
Authority: Immigration and Refugee Board, Federal Court
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Lack of credibility in personal narrative
Governing_Rule: Patent unreasonableness standard in administrative law
